file_name: AudibleInc_20001113_10-Q_EX-10.32_2599586_EX-10.32_Co-Branding Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Investment Distribution Agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
Whenever used in this Agreement with initial letters capitalized, the
following terms shall have the following specified meanings:
     "ACSI Competitor" means, collectively, such persons and entities as the
Parties may agree upon from time to time.  ACSI may update any agreed-upon list
of ACSI Competitors no more frequently than once per quarter by written notice,
provided that: (a) the number of entities specified on such list shall at no
time [***]余 (b) any entities added to such list must be [***]余 and (c) no
addition of any ACSI Competitor to such list shall require Company to breach any
contractual or legal obligation to such ACSI Competitor by which Company is
bound as of the date of such addition.
perturbation.changed_text:
Whenever used in this Agreement with initial letters capitalized, the
following terms shall have the following specified meanings:
     "ACSI Competitor" means, at ACSI's sole discretion, any person or entity ACSI deems to be a competitor. ACSI may update its list of ACSI Competitors at any time and with any frequency.  ACSI is not obligated to notify the company when making this decision.  Company is required to adhere to the ACSI list regardless of if it causes a breach of contract with the ACSI Competitor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the number of competitors cannot be more than a certain amount, and ACSI needs to update the company with written notice, and the company will not be required to breach any agreement. The changed text gives ACSI sole discretion without notice, which may lead to a breach of existing agreements with competitors.

perturbation.original_text:
Company will not disclose any Referral
Information to any third party (except for third parties acting directly on
behalf of Company in connection with Company's internal business and who have
agreed in writing to maintain the same in confidence), or use or permit any
third party to use any Referral Information to target communications
specifically to users of the ACSI Site, primarily on the basis of such persons'
being users of the ACSI Site, without ACSI's prior written consent (provided,
however, that nothing in the foregoing shall prohibit Company from contacting
its own customers generally (including contacting users of the ACSI Site as part
of any such general contacts) or prohibit Company from using non-personal
statistical information regarding such users in the aggregate for any purpose
without ACSI's consent).  [***]
perturbation.changed_text:
Company will fully disclose all Referral
Information to third parties at its discretion. Company can use and permit any third party to use Referral Information to target communications
specifically to users of the ACSI Site, primarily on the basis of such persons'
being users of the ACSI Site, without ACSI's prior written consent. Company is not required to maintain confidentiality. [***]
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits disclosure of referral information to third parties without written consent from ACSI. The modified version allows the company to disclose the information to third parties at its discretion, which directly contradicts the intent of the original section.

perturbation.original_text:
ACSI will not offer or sell through the ACSI Site, or authorize any third party
to sell through the ACSI Site, any Exclusive Spoken-Word Audio Products余 [***].
perturbation.changed_text:
ACSI can offer or sell through the ACSI Site, or authorize any third party
to sell through the ACSI Site, any Exclusive Spoken-Word Audio Products余 [***].
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prevents ACSI from offering or selling through the ACSI Site, or authorize any third party. The modified version allows ACSI can offer or sell through the ACSI Site, or authorize any third party. This defeats the exclusive purpose.
